page.title: 06CHARLBURY AFTER 1945
page.content: After 1945,when the war ended,people were still on rations and had been since 1940.Rationing continued until about 1953.In Charlbury there used to be 5 Grocers,2 Butchers,2 Bakers,3 Garages,a Post Office,a Barber,a Hairdresser, an Ironmonger,2 Gent's outfitters,a Chip shop,a Radio repairer and teashop,a Chemist,a Cinema and a Town Hall for dances etc. For employment people worked on the farms,in shops or at the Glove Factory. Some people made gloves at their own homes and others worked in the clothes factory or for the Council. Many people came to Charlbury as evacuees during the war and many of them have stayed here. During the 1960's Charlbury expanded as a result of new,private housing developments on the edge of the town.
